name: CreateAsanaTask
description:
Create and initiate an Asana task asynchronously.

This tool creates a job to instantiate a task in Asana using a specified task template. It should be called when you want to initiate a task based on a template, resulting in the creation of an asynchronous job that returns the job details.

parameters.name: task_template_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the task template used to create the task.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the task template.

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: List of optional properties to include in the task resource, comma-separated.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: task_name
parameters.description: The name of the new task to be created. If not provided, the task template name will be used by default.

value_schema.description: The name of the new task. If not provided, the name of the task template will be used.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable 'pretty' formatting of the response for better readability. Useful for debugging but may increase response time and size.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.
